articles.title: DPRK Delegation with S. Korean President Enjoys Performance of DPRK Art Troupe
articles.content:
DPRK High-Level Delegation with Moon Jae In Enjoys Congratulatory Performance Given by DPRK Art Troupe
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The high-level delegation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, enjoyed a congratulatory performance given by the art troupe of the DPRK in Seoul on Sunday together with south Korean President Moon Jae In and his wife.
					 Among the audience were members of the DPRK high-level delegation including Kim Yo Jong, first vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, leading members of the art troupe, Jo Myong Gyun, minister of Unification, To Jong Hwan, minister of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, Pak Won Sun, mayor of Seoul City, and other figures and masses of the south side and foreign diplomatic envoys in Seoul.
					
					 The art troupe of the DPRK led by Kwon Hyok Bong, department director of the Ministry of Culture, and Hyon Song Wol, head of the Samjiyon Orchestra, gave a performance again in Seoul in the wake of a congratulatory performance in Kangrung of south Korea on Feb. 8 ahead of the opening of the 23rd Winter Olympics.
					
					 When the introducer conveyed the compatriotic greetings of the people of the north amid the playing of the music of prelude "Glad to See You", the spectators broke into enthusiastic applause and cheers.
					
					 Our artistes put on the stage female chorus "Fly High, Doves", light music "My Country Is Best", string ensemble and female solo "Morning Star" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 Through serial orchestra "Dear Melodies" newly and specifically depicted with world famous songs, the performers showed their excellent skills.
					
					 When our artistes sang south Korean songs, the spectators followed the songs, waving their hands, and encored songs.
					
					 When the mood of performance was being revved up, Hyon Song Wol mounted the stage, expressed her impressions about the visit to the south side and sang the song "Mts. Paektu and Halla Are Part of My Motherland", delighting the spectators.
					
					 The performance ended with choruses "Our Wish Is Reunification" and "See You Again" sung by artistes of the north and the south.
					
					 At the end of the performance, Kim Yong Nam and Kim Yo Jong together with Moon Jae In and his wife extended greetings to the performers and spectators.
					
					 Jo Myong Gyun, To Jong Hwan and Pak Won Sun mounted the stage to congratulate our artistes upon their performance, giving bouquets to them.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the spectators.
					
					 Meanwhile, the DPRK high-level delegation was invited to a luncheon hosted by Ri Rak Yon, prime minister of south Korea, on the same day.
					
					 Present at the luncheon were all the members of the DPRK high-level delegation, Jo Myong Gyun, To Jong Hwan and others concerned of the south side.
					
					 Prior to the performance, the delegation was also invited to a send-off dinner hosted by Im Jong Sok, presidential chief of staff of Chongwadae.
					
					 The luncheon and dinner took place in an amicable atmosphere.

articles.title: DPRK High-level Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
DPRK High-level Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The high-level delegation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, which attended the opening ceremony of the 23rd Winter Olympics arrived here on Sunday.
					 "Chammae-2", a personal jet of the DPRK government flying corps, carrying the delegation aboard, took off Inchon International Airport around 21:55 and landed at Pyongyang International Airport around 22: 40.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam reviewed the guard of honor of the KPA services after receiving a salute from its first deputy chief.
					
					 Accompanying him were Kim Yo Jong, first vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Choe Hwi, chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, Ri Son Gwon, chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country, and other suite members.
					
					 The delegation was greeted by senior officials of the Party and government Kim Yong Chol, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Su Yong and Ri Yong Ho and leading officials of armed forces organs Pak Yong Sik and Choe Pu Il.

articles.title: DPRK Art Troupe Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK Art Troupe Returns Home
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- An art troupe of the DPRK led by Kwon Hyok Bong, department director of the Ministry of Culture, and Hyon Song Wol, head of the Samjiyon Orchestra, came back here on Monday after successfully completing its program of congratulatory performances for the 23rd Winter Olympics.
					 The troupe left Seoul Monday and came back via Kaesong around 11:00.
					
					 It was greeted by senior officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea including Kim Yo Jong, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and officials of the Ministry of Culture.
					
					 The performances given by it in Kangrung and Seoul of south Korea before full houses in celebration of the 23rd Winter Olympics deeply impressed the fellow countrymen aspiring after the national reconciliation and unity, evoking lively response among the people from all walks of life.

articles.title: Greetings to Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Presidium member of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution of Iran.
					 The message noted that after the victory in the revolution the Iranian people have achieved a lot of successes in the struggle to defend the gains of revolution and build a powerful state while repelling the ceaseless pressure and interference by the hostile forces.
					
					 The message expressed the belief that the good ties of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Iran would grow stronger, wishing the Iranian president bigger success in his work for the country's development and stability and the people's wellbeing.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Inspects Wonsan-Kalma Coastal Tourist Area under Construction
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Inspects Wonsan-Kalma Coastal Tourist Area under Construction
 Wonsan, February 12 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, made a field survey of the Wonsan-Kalma coastal tourist area under construction.
					 Going round the construction site, he gave a pep talk to soldier-builders working hard to finish the construction of tourist zone in a scenic spot on the east coast in the shortest period.
					
					 There took place a consultative meeting, at which measures were taken to make the relevant units provide a sufficient quantity of equipment and materials for the construction in good time and press ahead with the construction in the highest qualitative level.
					
					 Earlier, the premier inspected the Taean Heavy Machine Complex and the Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory. He discussed the matters arising in speeding up the updating of the production processes and increasing the production of parts of different kinds needed for various sectors of the national economy and new-type trolley buses.

articles.title: Talks Held between Vice-Chairman of C.C., WPK and Chairman of C.C., USNPN
articles.content:
Talks Held between Vice-Chairman of C.C., WPK and Chairman of C.C., USNPN
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here on Monday between Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Kamal Prasad Chaulagain, chairman of Central Committee of the United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal (USNPN).
					 Ri Su Yong informed that the Workers' Party of Korea and people of the DPRK are making a dynamic drive for implementing the decision of the 7th Congress of the WPK by dint of the single-minded unity and spirit of self-reliance and self-development, closely united around respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, and stressed the need to boost the friendly relations between the two parties.
					
					 Kamal Prasad Chaulagain said that he was pleased that the WPK is courageously breaking through the bottlenecks and difficulties under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He stressed that the USNPN would extend full support to the WPK in its struggle against imperialism and deepen many-sided exchange and cooperation between the two parties.
					
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Ryu Myong Son, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and officials concerned and from the opposite side were members of the USNPN delegation.

articles.title: Reception for Nepali Delegation
articles.content:
Reception for Nepali Delegation
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Monday hosted a reception for the delegation of the United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal on a visit to the DPRK on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star).
					 Present there on invitation was the delegation of the United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal led by Chairman of its Central Committee Kamal Prasad Chaulagain.
					
					 Attending it were Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, Ryu Myong Son, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Reception Given at Iranian Embassy
articles.content:
Reception Given at Iranian Embassy
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Iranian embassy here hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Monday to mark the 39th anniversary of the victory in the Islamic revolution of Iran.
					 Present there on invitation were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and concurrently minister of Higher Education who is chairman of the DPRK-Iran Friendship Parliamentary Group, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, Choe Hui Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Ambassador Seyed Mohsen Emadi and staff members of the Iranian embassy were on hand.

articles.title: Oath-taking Meeting Takes Place in Mt Paektu
articles.content:
Oath-taking Meeting Takes Place in Mt Paektu
Samjiyon, February 12 (KCNA) -- An oath-taking meeting for accomplishing the cause of the Juche revolution under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leader of the Korean revolution, took place at the secret camp in Mt Paektu Monday.
					 Present there were senior party and government officials Pak Kwang Ho, An Jong Su, Ro Tu Chol and No Kwang Chol, Chairman of the Ryanggang Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Ri Sang Won, officials of the Party Central Committee, armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, officers and men of the Korean People's Army, commanding officers and shock brigade members of the 216 Division, officials of Ryanggang Province and Samjiyon County and merited persons.
					
					 Speeches were made there to make a pledge.
					
					 The speakers noted that leader Kim Jong Il performed undying feats before the party, the revolution, the country and its people all his life, true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They stressed the need to further spruce up Samjiyon County, where the native home of Kim Jong Il is situated, as a large open-air museum for educating in the revolutionary traditions and as a paradise for the people without an equal in the world.
					
					 They said they would consider the historic victory won in building the nuclear force of the Republic as a springboard for new progress and wage a dynamic struggle to accomplish the patriotic cause of Kim Jong Il, the cause of building a powerful socialist nation, through an all-people all-out offensive.
					
					 They vowed to become thousand-fold fortresses and shields to devotedly defend the Party Central Committee headed by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid at Statue of Kim Jong Il in Samjiyon County
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid at Statue of Kim Jong Il in Samjiyon County
 Samjiyon, February 12 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were laid before the statue of leader Kim Jong Il in Samjiyon County of Ryanggang Province with due ceremony on Monday on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 Present at the ceremony were senior party and government officials Pak Kwang Ho, An Jong Su, Ro Tu Chol and No Kwang Chol, Chairman of the Ryanggang Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Ri Sang Won, officials of the WPK Central Committee and armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, men and officers of the Korean People's Army, commanding officers and members of the 216 Division and officials and working people in Ryanggang Province and Samjiyon County.
					
					 Laid at the statue was a floral basket in the name of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also placed were a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and a floral basket in the joint name of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 And laid were baskets of flowers in the names of KPA units, the 216 Division, party and power bodies and enterprises in Ryanggang Province and Samjiyon County.
					
					 The participants paid high tribute to the statue of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Order of Kim Jong Il Awarded to Meritorious Officials
articles.content:
Order of Kim Jong Il Awarded to Meritorious Officials
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Jong Il was conferred on Kang Nam Ik, Yun Kyong Chun, Ri Yong Sik, Ri Hun Jae, Kang Won Ae and Hwang Ok Hwa ahead of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They thoroughly equipped themselves with great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, vigorously mobilized masses for the drive to carry out the behests of the great leaders and uphold the Party's policies through good political work while setting examples and thus successfully fulfilled the revolutionary tasks entrusted by the Party.
					
					 A relevant decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was published on Feb. 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Prize Conferred on Sin Kum Song
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Prize Conferred on Sin Kum Song
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il Prize was conferred on Sin Kum Song ahead of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Sin Kum Song has made a great contribution to giving wide publicity to the greatness of the Workers' Party of Korea at home and abroad and the might of a single-hearted unity of Juche Korea and dynamically encouraging the Party members and other working people to the efforts for carrying out the behests of the great leaders and upholding the Party's policies by displaying boundless loyalty to the Party and the leader and high creative enthusiasm.
					
					 A relevant decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was published on February 9.

articles.title: DPRK Marks 30th Anniversary of Naming of Kimjongilia
articles.content:
DPRK Marks 30th Anniversary of Naming of Kimjongilia
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK marked the 30th anniversary of naming of immortal flower Kimjongilia.
					 Kimjongilia is the flower of the sun symbolizing the greatness of leader Kim Jong Il who made a great contribution to the country and the revolution, times and mankind and the flower in praise of the great man who enjoys the respect, fascination and trust of all people.
					
					 Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un gave meticulous guidance so that the Kimjongilia festival is held significantly with greater splendor on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star every year, and saw to it that a diploma bearing the smiling portrait of Kim Jong Il and a participation certificate were instituted newly for the festival.
					
					 A commemorative meeting took place at the Central Youth Hall on Monday.

articles.title: 15th Ceremony of Awarding February 16 Science and Technology Prize Held
articles.content:
15th Ceremony of Awarding February 16 Science and Technology Prize Held
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The 15th ceremony of awarding February 16 Science and Technology Prize took place at the People's Palace of Culture Monday.
					 Present there were Vice-Chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Pak Thae Song, Vice-Premier Jon Kwang Ho, Chairman of the Education Commission Kim Sung Du, officials concerned and scientists, technicians and teachers.
					
					 The scientists and technicians of the DPRK settled sci-tech problems arising in strengthening the independent and Juche characters of the national economy and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 The February 16 Science and Technology Prize certificate and medal were awarded to the fulfillment of more than 10 projects and the Scientific and Technical Innovation Prize certificate to the fulfillment of one project.
					
					 The awardees of certificates of the February 16 Science and Technology Prize and the Scientific and Technical Innovation Prize included more than 190 scientists, technicians, teachers and officials of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry and other units.
					
					 Five persons were selected as the best scientists and technicians of the state for 2017.

articles.title: Ice Sculpture Festival-2018 Held
articles.content:
Ice Sculpture Festival-2018 Held
 Samjiyon, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Ice Sculpture Festival-2018 for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il is now underway with splendor in Samjiyon County at the foot of Mt Paektu since February 4.
					 The shock brigade members of the regiment of the Ministry of People's Security of the 618 Construction Brigade of the 216 Division created more than 2 000 pieces of ice sculptures to put them on display.
					
					 Displayed at the center of the festival venue is a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il against the background of Mt Paektu and Jong Il Peak, and sculptures depicting immortal flower Kimjongilias, trees bearing slogans and other sculptures.
					
					 Some sculptures portrayed the people-bound train showing Kim Jong Il's long journey of patriotic devotion and thriving orchard, mass-production of Vinalon, Royal azaleas on Chol Pass and other objects as well as the looks of Samjiyon County turning into an icon county of the country.
					
					 Displayed there are sculptures making vivid and peculiar portrayal of new-type trucks and tractors developed by workers of Korea and proud change of Sepho Tableland, works showing the history of gold mountain, gold field and gold sea, and animal sculptures.

articles.title: Young People's Festival Opens
articles.content:
Young People's Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The 21st National Youth and Children's Festival of Loyalty opened with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall Monday to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The festival will be held, divided into political, artistic, sports and economic panels.

articles.title: Chinese and China-Resident Koreans Here
articles.content:
Chinese and China-Resident Koreans Here
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Chinese and China-resident Koreans came here Monday to take part in the 22nd Kimjongilia Festival.
					 Among them are Li Xiangjun, vice-president of the Azalea Branch of the China Flower Association, and Li Lu, manager of the Dandong, China, Tianri Trading Co. Ltd.
					
					 Arriving earlier were Choe Ryong Ho, vice-president for joint operation of Pyongyang University of Science and Technology, and his party.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Nepali Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Nepali Delegation
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from a delegation of the United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The gift was conveyed to Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, on Monday by head of the delegation Kamal Prasad Chaulagain, chairman of the C.C., United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued a stamp (one sheet) to commemorate the 30th anniversary of naming of Kimjongilia.
					 Immortal flower Kimjongilia is depicted in the oval sheet.
					
					 Seen on the upper part of the sheet are letters "30th anniversary of naming of immortal flower Kimjongilia" and "Juche 77 (1988)-Juche 107 (2018)".

articles.title: Frost Flowers in Sobaeksu Valley
articles.content:
Frost Flowers in Sobaeksu Valley
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Hoar frost admirably adorns the Sobaeksu Valley in the Paektusan Secret Camp, Samjiyon County, Ryanggang Province of the DPRK.
					 The scene of the valley covered with hoar frost is regarded as one of eight famous scenes of the Sobaeksu Valley.
					
					 In this regard, Kim Un Sim, a lecturer of the Management Office for Revolutionary Battle Sites in the Secret Camp of Mt Paektu, told KCNA:
					
					 There are springs around leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp, which flow into the Sobaeksu Stream even in winter. And the temperature of spring water is about 4 degrees.
					
					 In winter, the spray of the Sobaeksu Stream decorates its surroundings with frost flowers.
					
					 The DPRK people love the frost flowers in the valley which reflect their ardent yearning for Kim Jong Il and their firm will to materialize his lifelong desire.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Accused of Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Accused of Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities recently made a survey of evacuation places including the underground parking lots near Olympic stadium under the pretence of making preparations for rapid evacuation of Japanese tourists in case the DPRK's "missile attack" aiming at the Winter Olympics is made.
					 Joining in it, the House of Representatives of Japan worked out a plan for emergency evacuation of more than 460 dietmen out of meeting place to cope with "missile" fired by the DPRK. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says: 
					
					 These are hysteric fits of the wicked Japs trying to re-kindle a charcoal burning out to make a fire for coiling up the tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' rubbish about "missile attack" aiming at the Olympics is nothing but invective of political imbeciles hell-bent on confrontation with the DPRK, shameless outbursts which make even Don Quixote blush and sophism making profound confusion of right and wrong.
					
					 The arch criminals for creating a state of emergency for escalating tension on the peninsula are the U.S. which vociferates the "maximum pressure" and military option day and night and the Japanese reactionaries who are crazy for overseas expansion while dancing to the tune of their master.
					
					 The world clearly sees who is a real harasser of peace going frantic across the Korean Straits, holding daggers of confrontation in mouths, not content with spraying ashes at the other's event to disturb stability on the peninsula.
					
					 Their imprudent ambition would invite an irretrievable disaster to the island country.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Phohang City of S. Korea
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Phohang City of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 4.6 on the Richter scale reportedly jolted Phohang City, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea on Sunday.
					 The quake left some people wounded, buildings shaken and water pipes broken.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed by the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation on Feb. 2.
					 V. P. Isakov, first secretary of the league, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from Feb. 2 and 17 and decided to organize colorful political and cultural events such as a seminar and film show in praise of the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il in this period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Algeria
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Algeria
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed by the General Youth Union of Algeria on Feb. 4.
					 Muhammad Nouwar Al Rabie Kabaili, chairman of the union, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events such as a meeting and film show from Feb. 4 to 16.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in France
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in France
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A French preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Paris on Feb. 5.
					 Benoit Quennedey, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events in praise the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russian Library
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russian Library
 Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A Korean book-donating ceremony took place at the Science Library in Sakhalin Region of Russia on Jan. 30 with the approach of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present at the ceremony were several figures such as the curator of the library and officials of the DPRK mission in Vladivostok.
					
					 Works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un were donated.
					
					 The curator said that the world people were pleased that the DPRK, not a big country in its territory and population, is firmly defending its sovereignty and dignity while proudly standing up against the imperialist forces in the international arena. The curator noted that the Korean people would as ever make a dynamic advance along the road chosen by them.
					
					 The deputy curator sincerely congratulated the Korean people upon their successes in the efforts for bolstering up national defense capability and improving the people's living under the wise guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea, adding that the ones would know better about the DPRK reading the donated works.

articles.title: Delegacion norcoreana presencia funcion artistica junto con Moon Jae In
articles.content:
Delegacion norcoreana presencia funcion artistica junto con Moon Jae In
Pyongyang, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- La delegacion de alto nivel de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, presencio el dia 11 en Seul junto con el matrimonio del presidente surcoreano Moon Jae In la funcion del grupo artistico norcoreano.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Kim Yo Jong, primera subjefa de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, y otros miembros principales de la delegacion y del grupo artistico de la RPDC, las figuras surcoreanas inclusive Jo Myong Gyun, ministro de Unificacion, To Jong Hwan, ministro de Cultura, Deporte y Turismo, y Pak Won Sun, alcalde de Seul, los surcoreanos de diversos estratos, los representantes diplomaticos en Seul.
					
					En visperas de la ceremonia de apertura de los 23o Juegos Olimpicos Invernales, el grupo artistico norcoreano dirigido por Kwon Hyok Bong, director del Ministerio de Cultura, y Hyon Song Wol, jefa de la Orquesta Samjiyon, estreno el dia 8 en Kangrung y volvio a ofrecer en Seul su funcion.
					
					Cuando la interpretadora trasladaba el saludo de los norcoreanos, estallaron los aplausos y aclamaciones en el asiento.
					
					Se presentaron en la escena el coro femenino "Vuela alto, la paloma", la musica ligera "Es mejor mi pais", la orquesta de cuerda y el solo femenino "Lucero de alba" y otras piezas.
					
					En la musica orquestal en serie "Melodia intima", los interpretes demostraron sus excelentes talentos de ejecuciones.
					
					Cuando las artistas norcoreanas cantaban las canciones surcoreanas, los espectadores cantaron juntos agitando sus manos y solicitaron la repeticion.
					
					En el climax de la funcion, la jefa de la Orquesta Samjiyon subio a la escena donde expreso su impresion sobre su visita al Sur de Corea y canto la cancion "Es mi patria desde Paektu hasta Hanna", entusiasmando asi a los espectadores.
					
					La funcion termino con los coros de los artistas de ambas partes coreanas "Nuestro deseo es la reunificacion" y "Nos encontremos otra vez".
					
					Terminada la funcion, Kim Yong Nam y Kim Yo Jong enviaron el saludo junto con el matrimonio del presidente surcoreano a los ejecutantes y la audiencia.
					
					El ministro de Unificacion, el ministro de Cultura, Deporte y Turismo y el alcalde de Seul felicitaron el exito de la funcion entregando los ramos florales a los artistas norcoreanos.
					
					La funcion arranco la efusiva ovacion de los espectadores.
					
					El mismo dia, la delegacion norcoreana fue invitada al almuerzo preparado por el premier surcoreano Ri Rak Yon.
					
					Se distinguieron en el convite todos los miembros de la delegacion norcoreana, Jo Myong Gyun, To Jong Hwan y otros relacionados surcoreanos.
					
					La delegacion fue invitada a la cena de despedida ofrecida por Im Jong Sok, jefe del gabinete de los secretarios de Chongwadae.
					
					Las recepciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Regresa la delegacion de alto nivel de la RPDC
articles.content:
Regresa la delegacion de alto nivel de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- Llego el dia 11 a esta capital la delegacion de alto nivel de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, tras participar en la ceremonia inaugural de los 23o Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.
					A eso de las 21 y 55 minutos, la delegacion partio del Aeropuerto Internacional de Inchon a bordo del avion de uso particular "Chammae-2" de la aviacion del gobierno de la RPDC y llego a eso de las 22 y 40 minutos al Aeropuerto Internacional de Pyongyang. 
					
					Despues de recibir el parte de recepcion del primer subjefe de la guardia de honor de tipos de ejercito del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Yong Nam paso revista a sus filas. 
					
					Le acompanaron Kim Yo Jong, primera subjefa de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Hwi, presidente del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, Ri Son Gwon, presidente del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria, y otras comitivas. 
					
					Les recibieron Kim Yong Chol, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Su Yong y Ri Yong Ho, cuadros del partido y el gobierno, y Pak Yong Sik y Choe Pu Il, funcionarios responsables de las instituciones de las fuerzas armadas.

articles.title: Llega a Pyongyang el grupo artistico de RPDC
articles.content:
Llega a Pyongyang el grupo artistico de RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- El grupo artistico de la RPDC dirigido por Kwon Hyok Bong, director del Ministerio de Cultura, y Hyon Song Wol, jefa de la Orquesta Samjiyon, llego el dia 12 a esta capital tras culminar exitosamente su agenda de las funciones festivas para los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.
					El mismo dia, el grupo partio de Seul y paso a eso de las 11 por Kaesong.
					
					Fue acogido por Kim Yo Jong, primera subjefa de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, y otros cuadros del CC del PTC y los funcionarios del Ministerio de Cultura.
					
					Las funciones artisticas ofrecidas en Kangrung y Seul del Sur de Corea en felicitacion a ese evento deportivo produjeron grandes repercusiones de diversos estratos y dejaron el profundo eco a los miembros de la nacion coreana que desean la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju averigua los preparativos de construccion de zona turistica
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju averigua los preparativos de construccion de zona turistica
Wonsan, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado y primer ministro de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, averiguo en el terreno los preparativos de la construccion de la zona turistica costera Wonsan-Kalma.
					Durante el recorrido por varios puntos, el premier estimulo a los militares y constructores quienes se esfuerzan mucho por terminar en un corto plazo la construccion de la zona turistica en los lugares pintorescos del Mar Este.
					
					En la reunion consultiva convocada en el terreno, se tomaron las medidas para que las unidades relacionadas suministren a tiempo los equipos, materiales y otros necesarios para la obra.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier estuvo en el Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean y la Fabrica de Trolebus de Pyongyang donde discutio los problemas que se presentan en la marcha de la modernizacion del proceso de produccion y en el aumento de produccion de diversas piezas pedidas por varias ramas de la economia nacional y del medio de transporte publico de nuevo tipo.

articles.title: Conversan en Pyongyang Ri Su Yong y Kamal Prasad Chaulagain
articles.content:
Conversan en Pyongyang Ri Su Yong y Kamal Prasad Chaulagain
Pyongyang, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 12 en esta capital las conversaciones entre Ri Su Yong, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, y Kamal Prasad Chaulagain, presidente del Comite Central del Partido Socialista Nacional Unido de Nepal.
					  Ri Su Yong informo que el partido y el pueblo coreanos, unidos firmemente en torno al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, libran una vigorosa lucha por materializar la resolucion del Septimo Congreso del PTC basandose en el poderio de la unidad monolitica y del autofortalecimiento. Y se refirio a la necesidad de intensificar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad entre los dos partidos. 
					
					A su vez, Kamal Prasad Chaulagain apunto que se alegra mucho por el hecho de que bajo la sabia orientacion del respetado camarada Kim Jong Un el PTC supera osadamente las dificultades y las pruebas.
					
					Anadio que el PSNUN envia el entero apoyo a la lucha del PTC contra el imperialismo y seguira profundizando el intercambio y las cooperaciones multilaterales entre los dos partidos. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ryu Myong Son, y otros funcionarios interesados, por la parte coreana, y, por la nepalesa, los miembros de la delegacion del partido nepales.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto de juramento en Campamento Secreto del monte Paektu
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto de juramento en Campamento Secreto del monte Paektu
Samjiyon, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 12 en el Campamento Secreto del monte Paektu el acto de juramento para enaltecer al Dirigente Kim Jong Il como eterno lider de la revolucion coreana y llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche bajo la guia del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un. 
					Asistieron a la ocasion los cuadros directivos del Partido y el gobierno Pak Kwang Ho, An Jong Su, Ro Tu Chol y No Kwang Chol, el presidente del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la Provincia de Ryanggang, Ri Sang Won, los funcionarios del Comite Central del PTC, organismos de las fuerzas armadas, entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los comandantes y miembros de la Division de Construccion 216 y los funcionarios y ameritados de la provincia mencionada y del distrito de Samjiyon. 
					
					Al pronunciar discursos de juramento, los oradores recordaron que en acato al noble proposito del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Dirigente realizo durante su vida las imborrables proezas ante el Partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo. 
					
					Insistieron en la necesidad de acondicionar el distrito de Samjiyon, tierra natal del Dirigente, como gran museo al aire libre para la educacion en las tradiciones revolucionarias y el mejor paraiso del pueblo. 
					
					Manifestaron la decision de librar la ofensiva general de todo el pueblo tomando como trampolin de nuevo desarrollo la historica victoria alcanzada en la construccion de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la Republica y realizar ingentes esfuerzos por cumplir sin falta la causa patriotica de Kim Jong Il, la de construccion de una potencia socialista.
